141501.name: Old Maid
141501.description:
The perfect kid friendly game for the whole family! Play the classic card game Old Maid on your computer. Who will be left with the odd Queen to become the Old Maid? Played with a regular deck of 52 cards and 4 players. Compete against the computer's AI players for a real challenge. Enjoy a soothing soundtrack and smooth animated gameplay. Includes detailed in-game rules and help. Classic card game fun for all ages!

Features
Real Old Maid rules
Play against the computer AI
Fast animated play
Detailed game rules included
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141502.name: Battle Isle 2220: Shadow of the Emperor
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
141502.description:
Back of Box

A cutting edge 23rd century strategy war game.

Prepare to be tested to your limits in the latest chapter of the "Battle Isle" series.

Embittered memories and unresolved vendettas have done little to reinforce a brief period of stability. A new period of aggression looks imminent, the "Battle for Chromos" is about to begin yet again......

You are plunged head first into a world of politics, intrigue and lust for power. You are the strategist and massed armies of the Drullian nationalist, Ben Haris, are in your way. Your objective: Achieve total military supremacy or face the bitter consequences.

Will you be able to maintain the morale of your troops while guiding them through 20 different campaign maps and guarantee the success of your entire armed forces? Within "Shadow of the Emperor" your strategical and logistical abilities will be put to the ultimate test, in a bid to secure total victory.


Lead imperial armies in a glorious campaign of conquest across 40 turn-based battle scenarios, each with its own unique objectives.



Your arsenal: 64 different weapon systems including, army, aircraft and naval attack units.



Spectacular, fast-moving, texture-mapped, 3-D graphics take you right to the heart of the action.



Build roads, fortifications and magnetic rail tracks. Plan your infrastructure carefully to provide vital support to your fighting units.

141503.name: Piano Wizard Academy
141503.description:
A fun, intuitive program that teaches your children to play the piano through a natural game ... even if you have no music experience! This package includes all you need; you may also purchase the software and curriculum and keyboard separately. A fun, intuitive program that teaches your children to play the piano! This new approach to learning music really works. Even if you and your kids have no musical experience, your children will learn to play the piano, read music, grasp the basics of music theory and unleash their musical creativity! All through a fun game that gets kids making music immediately and keeps them excited to learn more. Compared to the cost and challenge of traditional piano lessons, Piano Wizard may be a great alternative for you, especially if you have multiple children.
Piano Wizard makes learning the piano fun!

Features
200 songs (includes 9 of Cymphonique's hits!)
4 levels of difficulty
Learn to play the piano!
Learn to read sheet music!

Source: The Developer Website.

141504.name: Piano Wizard Christmas
141504.description:
With Piano Wizard, learning to play the piano couldn't be easier! Simply select a song, and using any compatible USB piano keyboard, play along. No prior musical experience necessary. As your skills improve, select more advanced levels of difficulty. This special holiday edition of Piano Wizard is set to a special Christmas theme and contains holiday songs. This game makes learning the piano fun!

Features
25 songs
4 levels of difficulty
Record and replay songs
Festive Christmas-themed graphics
Classic holiday songs included

Source: The Developer Website.

141505.name: Piano Wizard Cymphonique
141505.description:
Learn to play the piano with Cymphonique! It's easy to get started... simply select a song and play along. Match the colors of the notes with the colors on the keyboard. You will be playing real songs on the piano the first time you play this game.

Use any compatible USB piano keyboard. No prior musical experience is necessary. As your skills improve, select more advanced levels of difficulty.

This FREE Lite version of Piano Wizard Cymphonique is a fully functional game. The Lite version contains 4 sample songs so you can get started learning to play and read music.

Piano Wizard makes learning the piano easy and fun!

Features
Special edition featuring Cymphonique
4 levels of difficulty
Learn to play the piano!
Learn to read sheet music
4 songs (Full version has 20 songs!)
FREE color stickers for your keyboard (with purchase of Full version)

Source: The Developer Website.

141506.name: Shizzle
141506.description:
From Patch's website:

"Heat up game night with this sizzling dice game! Toss the one-of-a-kind dice into the innovative Twist & Tumble Dice Cup, twist, and watch the dice tumble out! Create a line of color or number matches that will score big or make others lose big. In this game, you definitely want to Shizzle, and it’s better if you don’t fizzle!"

Players take turn rolling the dice and try to create a line of dice where the next die in line matches the previous by color or number. The more dice in your line, the more points you earn! You can reroll unused dice as many times as you want as long as you're always adding to the line. If not, you choke and lose all the points you've earned that turn.

The game ends when the bank is out of chips. The player with the most points at the end wins.

141507.name: Pinball (1999 / Webfoot)
141507.description:
Introducing the most realistic fully 3D pinball game on the market! Every detail simulates real pinball machines exactly, all the way down to animated LCD score boards. Featuring three different themes and an amazing digital CD soundtrack. You have to see this game to believe it, guaranteed to be the best video Pinball you've ever seen! The themes: - Viking's Life
- Jungle Warrior
- Curse of the Pharoah
Features

Incredible scrolling 3D pinball machines
Move, zoom and tilt camera
Digital sound effects and music
Smooth scrolling
3 Different Pinball Boards
Hi-color hardware accelerated 3D graphics
Digital sound effects andamp music

Source: The Developer Website.

141508.name: Pinball Creation
141508.description:
Full Tilt Fun! 10 full 3D tables of arcade thrills. Delight in non-stop arcade action as balls ricochet off bumpers, spiral through ramps, spin through bonuses, and more! Exhilarating fast-paced game play will keep you glued to your seat as you attempt to gain the highest score ever.

Features
10 amazing tables!
3D tables
Realistic sound effects
High Score Table
3, 4, or 5 ball option
True-to-life physics

Source: The Developer Website.

141509.name: Pinball Express
141509.description:
Full-tilt fun in this new pinball game featuring 4 different themes and 12 different tables.

Features
12 tables to play
4 themes: Racetrack, Haunted House, Alien Attack, The Circus
High-score table
Safe fun for kids
Cool musical soundtrack
Available for both PC and Mac

Source: The Developer Website.

141510.name: Pinball Master
141510.description:
Full Tilt Fun! 21 tables of arcade thrills. Delight in non-stop arcade action as balls ricochet off bumpers, spiral through ramps, spin through bonuses, and more! Exhilarating fast-paced game play will keep you glued to your seat as you attempt to gain the highest score ever.

Features
21 amazing tables!
Both 2D and 3D tables
Realistic sound effects
High Score Table
3, 4, or 5 ball option
True-to-life physics

Source: The Developer Website.

141511.name: Pinball Master 2
141511.description:
Full Tilt Fun! 10 full 3D tables of arcade thrills. Delight in non-stop arcade action as balls ricochet off bumpers, spiral through ramps, spin through bonuses, and more! Exhilarating fast-paced game play will keep you glued to your seat as you attempt to gain the highest score ever.

Features

3D tables

High Score Table
3, 4, or 5 ball option

141512.name: Pinochle
141512.description:
Play the classic card game Pinochle on your computer. Compete against the computer's AI player for a real challenge. Two-handed Pinochle is played with the standard 48-card Pinochle deck. The player who first reaches a total of 1,000 points wins a game. Enjoy a soothing soundtrack and smooth animated gameplay. Includes detailed in-game rules and help. Classic card game fun for all ages!

Features
Real Pinochle rules
Play against the computer AI
Fast animated play
Detailed game rules included
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141513.name: Phil Mickelson 2005 Golf
141513.description:
Phil Mickelson 2005 will amaze you with it's fun, enhanced graphics, and gameplay. Play as Phil Mickelson: You get his power, his control and his finesse. What are you going to do with it? Play against Phil Mickelson: Always wanted to play against Phil? Play as Phil's arch rival TIJAY! Play a round with 1 to 3 friends: Pass the phone around for a great round of golf! Personal Golf Course assembly: Build your own custom course or just play a hole or two at break time. Different game modes: Play Traditional, Match Play, Skins Game or Closest to the Pin Changing weather conditions: Don't let a little rain slow you down and don't ignore the wind!
TIPS™ A new TIPSTM lesson by the masters will be available for you to download about every couple of weeks. These instructions are valuable real world golf lessons, tips, and tricks from Phil's personal instructors. Each lesson is assembled in an easy-to-follow, visually compelling format, complete with photos and animations.

Features
3D golf course
Play as or against Phil Mickelson
Play a round with 1 to 3 friends
Personal Golf Course assembly
Different game modes
Changing weather conditions

Source: The Developer Website.

141514.name: Safari Kongo
141514.description:
Safari Kongo is an incredible, all-new 3D adventure! Journey through 21 challenging levels to rescue your companion from the clutches of the evil Ape King. Along the way you'll encounter a whole host of diabolical enemies including crazed monkeys, frenzied mice and demented dinosaurs. Travel through treacherous lava fields, lush jungles, barren deserts and ancient ruins in your quest.
Features

Play as the girl or the guy
Full 3D movement and rotations
Encounter crazy enemies
Jungle, desert, volcanoe, and forest levels
3D accelerator cards supported

Source: The Developer Website.

141515.name: Sears Tele-Games Organizer
141515.description:
Box Text

Sears Tele-Games Organizer

Attractive Woodgrain Finished Cartridge Cabinet

Holds 16 Video Game Cartridges

Telegames (Video Arcade/Super Video Arcade)
Atari
Intellivision

And All Compatible Cartridges

Convenient Instruction Booklet Compartment

141516.name: Santa Vs. The Evil Elves
141516.description:
It's almost Christmas time and renegade elves have hidden all of Santa's presents! Can you help navigate Santa's sleigh and collect the missing gifts? Beware, the elves have launched an all-out hot-air-baloon offensive! Steer clear of the Halloween candy-corns the evil elves are chucking at Santa.

Features
30 action-packed levels
High-score table
Super addicting game-play
Cool musical soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
141517.description:
A Study in Emerald is a game for two to five players based on the award-winning short story of the same name by Neil Gaiman. In this stylistic mash-up of Sherlock Holmes and H.P. Lovecraft, the worst has already happened and the world is now ruled by the Old Ones. However, a secret war is being fought to free mankind from their servitude. The game A Study in Emerald fleshes out this core idea by including historical figures from the late nineteenth century, most being persons involved in the anarchist movement of the time.

Deck-building forms the core of the game. You use influence cubes to bid for the right to draft cards and take control of cities. Each player has a secret identity, either a Restorationist fighting against the creatures or a Loyalist attempting to defend the status quo. Which side you are on determines what you score points for. An additional twist is that the performance of other players on the same side as you can stop you from winning if they are doing particularly badly, so you really want to know who is on which side. More specifically, when the game ends – and this can result from multiple causes, such as a marker on the War or Revolution track hitting 15 or the assassination of a Restorationist player agent – then the sides compare their scores; which side has the lowest score automatically loses, then the player with the highest score on the remaining team wins the game.

The game takes around ninety minutes to play and is more complex than most, so more suitable for the experienced gamer.
141517.name: A Study in Emerald

141518.name: Freedom Stick
141518.description:
Back of Box

Features:


Wireless remote control eliminates messy wires



Feel and action of an arcade joystick



8 Direction precision micro action puts you in control



Infrared receiver with universal adapator makes Freedom Stick Wireless Remote Control compatible with Nintendo, Sega, Atari 2600, 7800 and XE and Commodore 64, C64 and C128



Automatic rapid fire or manual fire will help improve your scores



Play 1 and 2 player games plus 2 player simultaneous games (requires 2 Freedom Stick Wireless Remote Control units)



Multi directional signal allows freedom of movement



Operates at maximum efficiency up to 18' away from infrared receiver



Suction cups provided for optimum stability



Requires 4 AA alkaline batteries (not included)


Electronic Gameplayer Magazine writes

"Freedom Stick wireless remote control by Camerica Corporation is a real breakthrough in joystick technology.

Those annoying wires are finally gone with no loss of control or performance.

In fact, Freedom Stick wireless remote control's 8 direction precision micro action provides the same type of precise control found in arcade joysticks. Players who want the ultimate in freedom and control will love new Freedom Stick wireless remote control."

141519.name: Atari Trak-Ball Controller
videogamehwversion: North American Atari Pro-Line Trak-Ball Controller (CX22)
141519.description:
User Summary

A track ball controller designed to be used with any joystick compatible game. The controller features a fire button on each side to allow for right or left handed use. The box for the Pro-Line release was marked as being compatible with the Commodore 64 and VIC-20 in addition to Atari systems.

141521.name: The Sugar Hill Invasion
141521.description:
From publisher blurb:

Animated character are busting out of Saturday morning television and invading our dimension! What nefarious mastermind is behind this cartoon chaos and can your heroes stop it?

The Sugar Hill Invasion is a scenario for the ICONS roleplaying game. This adventure contains standees of the important NPCs and antagonists as well as play-tested tips on getting the most fun from the adventure.

141523.description:
Killer Bunnies: Heroes vs. Villains - Blue Starter Deck is a standalone game in the Killer Bunnies universe. Drawing and playing cards from a shared deck, players may choose to be a defender of goodness, courageousness and virtue by playing the Hero Super Bunnies or a generator of chaos, evilness and deceit by playing the Villain Super Bunnies. Whoever they are, the players use their bunnies' powers to build cities, attack opponents, and protect themselves. The first player who has a predetermined number of bunnies in the Bunny Circle and cities in the City Circle wins!

Killer Bunnies: Heroes vs. Villains - Blue Starter Deck is compatible with Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey; the deck in this game may be used as the yellow, blue, and green E-decks in that game. Though this game is for four players; equipment is only provided for three players under Odyssey's rules, as there are only three colors represented in this game.
141523.name: Killer Bunnies: Heroes vs. Villains – Blue Starter Deck

141524.name: Business Guru
141524.description:
Business Guru is effectively an Indian variant of Monopoly.

Players buy and sell property, build houses and hotels, and collect rent from their fellow players. Properties, however, are entire nations, rather than pieces of real estate. Airlines and shipping lines also replace railways in Business Guru.

There are other small differences, but the roll-and-move system is very reminiscent of Monopoly-style games.

141525.name: Million Dollar Idea
141525.description:
Million Dollar Idea is a roll-and-move game where players try to become the most successful (and thereby wealthiest) businessmen through entrepreneurship. The game board has three concentric circles around which the players must move their pawns (by rolling dice) to progress through the game.

The outer circle represents "starting up your business". By landing on the various spaces of this circle, players must complete certain tasks through negotiation and by drawing cards before moving on to the second circle.

The second circle (referred to as the "inner circle") represents "operating your business". Players move their pawns through this circle in a similar manner to the outer circle.

When a player has accumulated sufficient wealth and experience from game spaces, cards, and negotiations, he may move to the "inner path and winner's circle". If a player has completed the requirements for wealth and experience ahead of his opponents, he moves to the winner's circle and wins the game.

From the game box:

"Million Dollar Idea is an exciting new board game in which players escape the corporate rut and exercise their entrepreneurial spirit. In Million Dollar Idea you market your own 'great idea' by forming a company, obtaining financing and making money through the sales of your invention. Unfortunately while you strive for success, dilemmas such as competitors who steal your ideas, union problems, lawsuits, and the ever-present threat of a hostile take-over test your business acumen while doubling your blood pressure."

141526.name: Final Lap: the card game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #080 - Five in Your Face
141526.description:
Final Lap: the card game is a standalone card game that challenges up to 6 players (can be played solo) to lead their team to victory in the racing championship. A challenging card game with a great balance of skill and luck, and lots of interesting card combinations. Average play time is around 10 minutes per race, with the players deciding how many races they want to play in order to decide the championship winner, allowing Final Lap to be played as a time filler, or an entire evening of entertainment.

Players each manage a racing team of two cars and compete in a number of races through to see who can accumulate the most championship points and become the champion. In each race players need to correctly manage their hand of cards, reaping the biggest rewards possible from their good cards, and reducing the negative imapct suffered from their bad ones, to ensure the cars in their team score as many championship points as possible.

Championship points are only scored in a race by the cars that finish in the top 6 positions. At the beginning of each race the cars are laid out in the reverse finishing order from the previous race. Each player is dealt a hand of cards and during a race a player must use all of the cards in their hand. As a car finishing in last place will ensure that it begins qualifying in the following race in first position, it is therefore beneficial for cars to finish as low as possible in a race if they do not finish in the top 6 positions, which results some very interesting and tactical game play.

After the cars are laid out in order at the beginning of a race, and players have received their hand of cards, qualifying will take place. Certain cards can be used during qualifying or during a race. If a player uses a card during qualifying to improve the qualifying order of one or both of their cars, they will discard the card and draw a random card to replace it. Since players must use all of the cards in their hand during a race, they will need to evaluate whether they can afford to use such cards during qualifying as it may result it them drawing a very bad card as a replacement.

During a race players can have their cars take pit stops. When a car takes it pit stop it allows the players to discard a card from their hand without having to play it, which acts as an outlet to remove bad cards from a players hand. Pit stops need to be managed effectively as they can only be taken by cars that require them, and any cards not discarded through pit stops must be played even if they have severely negative consequences for your cars.

Excellent hand management is crucial in this game. After you receive your hand of cards you need to formulate a race plan, working out how to get the most out of the cards you’ve been dealt. Adaptability is also key, being able to change a race plan or abandon it altogether as interactions with other players may not go as expected.

Final Lap is a hugely flavourful card game, with a whole range of racing events covered by cards, including qualifying, pit stops, crashes, oil spills, spin outs, tyre punctures, yellow flags, team orders, defensive lines, slip streaming, car setup, racing strategies, repairs and mechanical problems with engines and gear boxes.

141527.description:
Biker/Zombie is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game.

141528.name: Plus und Minus bis 100: Memo Spiel
141528.description:
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a mathematical operation on one tile and answer on another tile to look for in this game.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

141529.name: Mengen und Größen: Memo-Spiel
141529.description:
"Quantities and sizes"
Like in usual Memory players look for pair of tiles but instead of similar tiles there is a similar types but different quantities or sizes on tiles to look for in this game.
f.e. player must match pair with 10 minutes and 600 seconds.

Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

141531.name: Selbstlaute: Mau-Mau-Spiel
141531.description:
a, e, i, o, u - who hears what words have the same vowels?

Players may play the card on the middle stack if the word on that card he/she plays has the same vowel if the word on the topmost card.

Player who first gets rid of his cards is the winner.

141532.description:

141534.name: Monty Plays Scrabble
141534.description:
User Summary

A computer opponent that allows you to play Scrabble against your TRS-80. A copy of the Selchow & Righter board game is required.

An unusual feature of this software was that the disk was designed to prevent any backup copies from being made (unlike its predecessor, Monty Plays Monopoly, which at least allowed a single backup copy to be made).

Game Manual

A recent interview with MONTY revealed some important points you will want to know before accepting his challenge to the SCRABBLE Brand Crossword Game.

Q: MONTY, what have you been doing since your famous competition with the U.S. MONOPOLY champion?

M: I felt I needed to improve my vocabulary, so I've taken up SCRABBLE.

Q: Have you made much progress?

M: So far I've learned more than 54,000 words, and I was really surprised to discover how many words there are that I had never heard of before. My vocabulary now contains a veritable myriad of abstruse locutions.

Q: Amazing! I imagine you are hard to beat.

M: So I've been told. This is why I let people choose a SKILL LEVEL when they play with me. I play quickly at the lower levels, but it can take me several minutes to think of the best play at the top. It's only at the highest level that I use my full potential.

Q: Do you play according to the official rules?

M: Indubitably. I'm just like any other player.

Q: How does CHALLENGING work?

M: I always ask if there is any challenge at the end of each play. We will be playing according to the most recent rules regarding challenging. This means that if the challenged word is found to be a legal word, then the person challenging it loses his next turn. (By the way, don't be surprised if I challenge your word.)

Q: How does the game end, MONTY?

M: The game will end automatically as soon as one of the players has used all of his tiles and no more are available. However, if no one, including me, can think of a play using the tiles he has left, just choose menu option 7 to end the game.

Q: Any closing words, MONTY?

M: I hope I have cogently elucidated the salient points of the game. I look forward to many enjoyable hours with fellow SCRABBLE enthusiasts all over the world.

141535.name: Wörter mit ss und ß: Rechtschreib-Spiel
141535.description:
Lasso, Fluss, Tasse, Karussell - Maßband, Großeltern, Straße, Blumenstrauß
German language "S"-sensitive spelling card game.

Cards are placed face up on the table. In turn, each player may take the card that he can safely assign either "ss" or "ß". The children then check themselves by just looking at the word on the back of the card.
Who sets four words with "ss" or "ß" first wins the game.

141536.name: Games Pack Three: Meteor Mission 2 – Cosmic Fighter
141536.description:
User Summary

Radio Shack sold this compilation of two Big Five Software arcade games.

141537.name: Games Pack Two: Defense Command – Stellar Escort
141537.description:
User Summary

Radio Shack sold this compilation of two Big Five Software arcade games.

141538.name: Tolvan
141538.description:
This is a minigame where you take turns to roll three dice and hopefully add up the numbers in ways that allow you to advance your pawn on a track from 1 to 12 and back again. You may keep rolling as long as you manage to advance, but if you then get a useless roll you go back to where you were.

Apparently if you subtract the press-your-luck element you get a traditional game known as Ohio or Martinetti.

141539.name: Chez Geek: Promokarte Pegasus-Supporter
141539.description:
A German promo card for Chez Geek with the following text:

German original:

Pegasus-Supporter
Person
Slack 3
Der Pegasus-Supporter wird sich immer sofort in den Raum mit den meisten Spielen-Karten [sic!*] begeben (bei Gleichstand in jedem Zug auswürfeln). Hier ist er von vielen Leuten umgeben, die genauso gerne spielen wie er.
"Das Spiel ist ganz einfach. Ich erklär euch mal kurz die Regeln..."


"Spiele-Karten" is what seems to be meant.


English translation:

Pegasus Supporter
Person
Slack 3
The Pegasus Supporter will always immediately go to the room with the most Game cards (roll a die in case of a tie). Here he is surrounded by people who like gaming as much as he does.
"The game is very easy. I'll quickly explain you the rules..."

141540.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 4 - Spring 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Magnetically Accelerated High Energy Missile (MAHEM) System
The Saurian Cycle: A Roadmap to Adventure
141540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hello explorers!

Issue 4 of the Frontier Explorer is now available for download. This issue provides a fresh look at the Saurian race published originally in Dragon! Magazine issue 103 (Nov 1985) and provides new ships, weapons and creatures related to the Saurians and Spacefleets initial contact with the new race.

Much of the content of this issue was due to inspiration from the lead article on Subspace Radios. You can find the details of how the issue came to be in our letter from the editors. Additionally the issue includes another Jurak Hangna creature write up as well as a short story by a new fiction author.

The issue content (articles) are:

Subspace Radios
Animal Handling Skill
Spacefleet Signal Corps
Talnor Class Communications Ship
The Saurian Cycle - A Roadmap to Adventure
The Sauria Sector
Saurian Spacecraft
Magnetically Accelerated High Energy Missile (MAHEM) System
A Saurian Affair
Kischen Planetary Report
The Infita
Love And Atomic Rockets
Gear Up For Adventure
Morgaine's World
Grymz Guide Comic #4




Grab your copy and keep exploring new frontiers.

141541.name: Perils of the Surface World
141541.description:
From the back of the book:

A lost civilization in need of a miracle. A frozen city harboring a terrifying secret. An ancient legacy best left undisturbed. A crime lord determined to conquer a hemisphere.

Hollow Earth Expedition: Perils of the Surface World compiles four adventure scenarios that span the globe and deliver a walloping punch of pulp-era adventure. Your characters will battle Nazis in the tropical jungles of Brazil, unearth monsters in the frigid wastes of Antarctica, unravel mysteries in the catacombs beneath Venice, and contend with martial arts masters in the back alleys of Shanghai. Each of these scenarios can stand alone or may be added into existing campaigns, linked together with each other, or used to open the way to further adventures inside the Hollow Earth.

Perils of the Surface World also delivers new resources for the Gamemaster, including optional rules for martial arts super-powers, Atlantean sorcery, supernatural terror, and more. Add these tools to your kit to adapt and expand your adventures and your characters in these or your own stories!

Strap on your holster, grab your fedora, and get ready for two-fisted pulp adventure!

141542.name: Cityspiel Münster: Wer ist der cleverste Unternehmensgründer der Stadt?
141542.description:
A city marketing game supported by the city of Münster featuring many of the city's companies. Intended to playfully get to know the city (and the companies).

According to the back cover, luck and tactics are decisive in this game.

Here is what the rules say about the goal of the game:

"Es wird der beste Unternehmensgründer in der Stadt gesucht. Dazu müssen Unternehmenslogos schnell und geschickt auf dem Stadtplan aufgebaut werden. Wer dabei seine gegründeten Unternehmen sinnvoll erweitert und vielleicht sogar fremde Unternehmen übernehmen kann, gehört zu den ersten Anwärtern auf den Sieg."

English translation:

We are looking for the best founder of companies in town. The logos of companies have to be quickly and cleverly built on the city map. He who expands his founded companies sensibly and maybe even takes over opponent's companies is among the first candidates for victory.

Additional information:

The game board is a map of the city of Münster. Players move based on which of four movement symbols they roll on a six-sided die (by foot, bike, car or bus). On the remaining two symbols, event cards are drawn. Players can expand or take over companies by reaching adjacent areas. In the end, they score victory points for the number and size of their companies and for the majority of companies in each of the four quadrants of the map.

141544.name: Cluedo: Die drei ???
141544.description:
Cluedo "Drei Fragezeichen": This is a variant on the famous whodunnit detective game (called Cluedo in the UK, Clue in the US) especially for younger children to play.

In this variant players move between different places fans of the three investigators will surely notice. 6 different items have disappeared in Rocky Beach, but only one of these has really been stolen. Players try to find out which item was stolen by which person and where. For this you take over the role of the three investigators and their friends - Aunt Mathilda, Inspector Cotta and Uncle Titus. Every character has a special ability which can be used once per game (e.g. move a second time). Just like in the original version, players move on the board. As soon as they enter a room/place, they can ask questions about the crime. Each player has a certain amount of cards in his hand, 3 cards have been put to the side - they say where the crime took place, who the thief is and which item was stolen. It's the players' goal to solve the crime. With the help of questions and your cards, you try to find out as much as possible about the case so that you will be the one to solve the mystery in the end and predict which cards have been set aside.
All items, characters and places are based on the adventures of the three investigators. The place where you can solve the mystery, for example, is the old house trainer in Uncle Titus' salvage yard. Amongst the criminals players can find the investigators' arch enemy Skinny Norris, for example.

141546.name: Bibi Blocksberg auf dem Martinshof
141546.description:
Bibi Blocksberg and her friends know that their favourite horse Sabrina has had a foal so they leave the village of Martinshof to see the new arrival. But Sabrina and foal are missing.

Players move by a die roll although there are lots of choices (take this path or take that path, etc.). They must collect different pieces of equipment (Sugar, Hay, Reins and Saddle) which they will need if they are to take the missing pair with them. Certain spaces require the drawing of an Event card and the instructions must be followed (sometimes it could mean that all players are affected).

The first player to get Sabrina and the Foal back to Martinshof wins.

141547.description:
The name of the game is Walled City attributed to the Battle of Troy.

Walled City is a simple strategy breakthrough game in which the players try to capture opponent's home city. There are 4 small red tiles that are placed in the center of the table to form the wall. The side of the wall facing each player is their inner wall. The inner wall extends to an imaginary horizontal line. The space before the inner wall is the player's home city.

Both players have 11 Warrior pieces: the Trojan Horse (1 big square tile), the cavalry unit ( 1 of 1x1 tile, 1 of 2x1 tiles, 1 of 1x2 tile), the swordsmen (1 of 1x1 tile, 1 of 2x1 tile, 1 of 1x12 tile), the spearmen (2 of 1x1), the archer (1 of 1x1), and the king (1x1). The actions that may be available to the warriors are:
- Move a tile in one-space
- Move a tile in a straight-line
- Move a tile over on the other side
The game starts by placing the 4 red tiles to form the wall. After which, players then take turn to either place or move any of their tiles. The Trojan Horse may be introduced any time but it must be placed first behind the player's inner wall. The Trojan Horse takes on the characteristics of any piece of the same color it touches at the time. The swordsmen can move up to three one-spaces. The cavalry can play one of the actions per turn. The spearmen can be placed to any free side of a piece orthogonally adjacent to the spearmen tile. The archer can play one or two actions per turn. The king can have a series of actions per turn but these actions can only be done on the pieces of the same color. Each piece must link to another piece at all time and at least one side of the Trojan Horse piece must be free after each turn.

The game ends with the first Trojan Horse to get into the opponent's home city.
141547.name: Walled City
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 49 - Top Ten Party Games for Gamers and Walled City

141548.name: Der Ruf - Ausgabe 1 (Sep 2005)
rpgissue: Der Ruf: Magazin für düsteres Rollenspiel
rpgissuearticle: Das Grauen, das aus den Boxen kam
Handout Tutorial #1: Wie Google beim Erstellen von Handouts helfen kann
Kleine blutige Brocken I: Fallen im modernen Rollenspiel
Would you love a monster man
141548.description:
User summary

The inaugural issue of Der Ruf contains scenarios for Call of Cthulhu (set in World War I) and KULT (set in New York). It also includes the deathworld Cypress, a planet for the SLA Industries Galaxy Project. Several general articles complete the issue.

141549.name: Chance oder Logik
141549.description:
Unusual game intended for a communist state as East Germany was at the ime.

Players start with 10,000 Deutschmarks. The board has a long track that, at times, offers a short or long route (and on two places a third track is offered). Movement is by a die.

At several points there are numbers. These numbers relate to cards (there are thus 26 cards and 26 special spaces). Before you start on a short or longer path, you can look at the numbers on such a track. This might imfluence your decision. A general rule is that the longer the track taken, the more your money is secure. However there are bonuses to be earned by finishing the track quickly. So you must balance speed against risk.

After all the players have finished, money is counted up and the player with the most Deutschmarks, wins.

141550.name: Mythic Origins
141550.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seize the mythic might of the Pathfinder world with Pathfinder Player Companion: Mythic Origins. Expanding upon the incredible powers and world-shaking magic of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game’s newest hardcover, Mythic Adventures, this player-focused guide brings that arsenal of options into the Pathfinder world. Grant your characters a host of new abilities for every mythic path, feats, spells, magic items, and more drawn from the Pathfinder campaign setting’s wildest legends, forgotten histories, and otherworldly planes. Learn what it means to be a mythic hero in the Pathfinder world and, even if you don’t have mythic power, how you can still benefit from (or even claim) such epic forces.

Each monthly 32-page Pathfinder Player Companion contains several player-focused articles exploring the volume’s theme as well as short articles with innovative new rules for all types of characters, as well as traits to better anchor the player to the campaign.

141551.name: Slay! (Ausgabe 1 - Mar 2013)
141551.description: The first issue of Slay! offers a lot of material and ideas on winter: Dungeons and encounters clad in snow and ice.

141552.name: Bajo el Sol Naciente
141552.description:
De la contraportada del libro:

"Lo dicen todos los libros de historia: la humanidad ha sido la primera especie inteligente que ha habido en nuestro planeta. pero los libros de historia mienten o, al menos, están llenos de silencios misericordiosos.

Marzo de 1932. El joven e inexperto emperador Hirohito no ha sido capaz de frenar a los altos mandos del ejército, que se ha lanzado a una carrera por aumentar los dominios del imperio. Pero tras la rápida y despiadada conquista de Manchuria, apenas finalizada unas semanas atrás, el mundo ha puesto sus ojos en Japón y ha amenazado con imponer severas sanciones económicas al Imperio del Sol Naciente. Atrapado entre la espada y la pared, Japón busca una justificación que legitime sus conquistas.

En las últimas semanas, de manera inesperada, el gobierno se ha topado con una posible justificación para sus invasiones. En una pequeña isla del mar Amarillo conocida como Yusa, frente a las costas de Manchuria, se han descubierto restos de vasijas e ídolos que parecen proceder de principios del período Jomon (14.000 a.C.), es decir, que hay pruebas de la presencia de japoneses en la zona hace más de diez mil años. ¿Es posible que las costas de Corea y Manchuria fueran, miles de años atrás, habitadas por japoneses? Iwao Seiichi, el ambicioso arqueólogo de la Universidad Koyasan, descubridor de este fabuloso yacimiento, cree que fue así, y que chinos y coreanos no son más que una rama perdida del pueblo japonés, lo que justificaría las injerencias imperiales en la zona. Desgraciadamente, el profesor Iwao y sus ayudantes desaparecieron sin dejar rastro hace dos semanas, quedando los trabajos arqueológicos totalmente paralizados."

From the back of the book:

"All the history books say it: humanity is the first intelligent species that has been on our planet. But the history books lie or, at least, are full of merciful silence.

March 1932. The young and inexperienced Emperor Hirohito has not been able to curb the high command of the army, which has embarked on a race to increase the dominions of the empire. But after the rapid and ruthless conquest of Manchuria, just finished a few weeks ago, the world has its eyes on Japan and has threatened to impose severe economic sanctions on the Empire of the Rising Sun. Caught between a rock and a hard place, Japan seeks a justification to legitimize their conquests.

In recent weeks, unexpectedly, the government has come up with a possible justification for their invasion. On a Yellow Sea small island known as Yusa, off the coast of Manchuria, were discovered remains of pots and idols that appear to come from the early Jomon period (14,000 BC), ie no evidence of the presence of Japanese in the area for over ten thousand years. Is it possible that the coasts of Korea and Manchuria were thousands of years ago, inhabited by Japanese? Iwao Seiichi, the ambitious Koyasan University archaeologist who discovered this fabulous site, thinks so, and that Chinese and Koreans are not lost more than a branch of the Japanese people, justifying imperial interference in the area. Unfortunately, Professor Iwao and his assistants disappeared without trace two weeks ago, being totally paralyzed archaeological work."

141553.description:
Spankham Asylum, a study-ground for those grappling with understanding strange fetishes and psychosexual condition. Doctor Karr investigates a spate of strange, new, tentacular fantasies with the aid of The Patient.

Expand your Cthentacle games into the realm of psychiatry with straitjackets, therapy, tranquilisers and dangerous readings from The Book of Eiboner.
141553.name: Cthentacle: Spankham Asylum

141554.name: The Three Little Pigs
141554.description:
This is a game produced under the name "a Little Golden Game" by the Golden Books publisher.
A game for 2 to 4 Players ages 5 to 8.

In the game Three Little Pigs, one player is the wolf and the other players are pigs. The players will take turns spinning and moving their pieces on the board to the next matching color of the spinner. If a pig lands on a path leading to a house, they hide in that house. If the wolf lands on a path leading to a house (straw or stick) he blows it down.
The wolf player wins if he successfully blows down the straw and stick houses. The pig player(s) wins if he successfully hides all three of his pigs.

141555.name: Old MacDonald Had a Farm
141555.description:
This is a game produced by Golden Books under the name "a Little Golden Game".
A game for 2 to 4 players ages 5 to 8.

This is a children's game that touches on a type of memory game.
Players start with a Scoring Board in front of them. In turn, players will announce "Heads" or "Tails" and flip over one of the Animal Cards in the center of the table. If they called the correct animal part (heads or tails) they get to keep that Animal Card and take another turn.
When they get the matching head and tail of an animal, they place the completed animal on their Scoring Card.

141556.name: Shattered Moon Core Book
141556.description:
From publisher blurb:

The moon shattered, and with it your old life; now it's time to make a new one in a world gone wild.

The purging and enslavement of the human race by the Dark Lady and her lilim and the return of magic, means Earth is becoming more messy than its ever been and you, as one of the nuoSidhe have a decision to make - side with the Dark Goddess or protect the last vestiges of human existence.

Because without you, they don't stand a goblin's chance in hell.

The forces of the Goddess, Lilith, the Dark Lady, stride forth to conquer and subjugate the earth to her will. She has awoken the titans from their ancient slumber and sundered Oberon's Seal, unleashing magic into a world dominated by science and logic for a millennium. You were human once, but that feels like ancient history. With the breaking of Oberon's Seal your soul revealed its true self. You are Sidhe. For over a thousand years since the seal cut off the influences of the Warp from the earth you have lived dozens of lives in human form, never realising what you really were but always feeling that you were different, never truly at peace in flesh or spirit. Now you are whole, in a world being torn apart at the Dark Lady's will. The moon has been shattered and the remnants have fallen to the earth bringing fire, destruction and worse.

What you get in the 320 pages:

Details of Earth in the Shattered Moon setting
Five nuoSidhe playable races: Dwarf, Elf, Goblin, Ogre, Troll; each with their own unique abilities and seelie and unseelie court abilities
Flexible and unique avatar generation system
34 vocations with unique abilities; prowess, talents and possessions
6 quickstart avatar templates: Troll blade, Goblin cloaker, Elf keeper, Elf skint, Dwarf tinker and Ogre weaver
Full list of prowess including the new Expert Marksman
110 assea weaves including five never before published weaves
Comprehensive rule book covering the FateStorm system with new rules for modern weapons and automatic fire
Detailed example of play
List of 37 story cast: personalities, creatures and monsters (including fey, undead, lilim and Knights of Seth)
Resource list: including new armour generation, modern weapons and sidhe items
Avatar record sheet - specially designed for use with Shattered Moon
HeroCycle record sheet
Copy of the FateDeck
Extensive index
Glossary of terms

141557.name: Shattered Moon Players' Pack
141557.description:
From publisher blurb:

This players’ pack is made for those who intend to play Shattered Moon as an avatar. It contains high resolution duplicates of the avatar record sheet and templates from the core rule book for players to print and use.

In addition there is an asseath’s resource sheet to maintain more detailed records of known weaves and any foci and fetish the avatar may own not published in the core rule book.

141558.name: Ogre Pledged and Devout
141558.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ogre pledged and devout; a racial-vocation supplement for Shattered Moon.

Ogres are protectors of nature – but for some it is a calling beyond the natural.

As an ogre pledged or devout you are closer to nature than your kin, and should anything endanger your sacred bond you know how to bring the pain in new and exciting ways.

As pledged or devout you are nature’s fury.

Included in the supplement:

Details of the Pledged and Devout racial vocations for ogres.
Three detailed example templates (Badger pledge, Disease pledge and Fire pledge), including completed avatar record sheets ready to begin play and template tactics review.
Three new assea weaves: Elemental weapon, Nature's wrath and Patient X.

141559.name: Ascendancy: Rogue Marshal Core Book
141559.description:
From publisher blurb:

ASCENDANCY - Rogue Marshal, draws the players into a world of political intrigue and power plays; psychotic serial killers and obsessed fetish gangs; deranged cults that call forth eldritch nightmares; and mad inventors who create mechanical and chemical abominations. All amid the background of Ashendrya — The Endless City.

Ashendrya is a city so vast that normal citizens are called upon to act as its wardens in time of need; and there is always a need. While industrial cabals wage secret wars that threaten to engulf whole regions of the city, malign cults pray to Shiok, the mad god, and call his influence into the very heart of Ashendrya.

In Ashendrya, celebrity, fame and fashion are proof of success, poisoning the weak of mind to fall into madness; the poor are left to rot in the low regions, without light or hope, or join the nation's fighting forces and march to war.

Ascendancy, a core rule book, provides everything the aspiring game master needs to run a FateStorm game, as well as information on setting, creatures, character development and suggested story arcs.

With 288 pages including;

5 new unique races
a broad bestiary covering the most common creatures, manifesicants, and npcs
more than 100 unique magical weaves
a long list of highly detailed magical artefacts for use in your games
over 40 unique vocations and vocation paths for the Avatars to follow
And a highly detailed dark fantasy setting with npcs, maps, locations and story hooks

141560.name: Ascendancy: Rogue Marshal - Steam and Steel
141560.description:
From publisher blurb:


Tool up, adept!

You are at the vanguard of a new age, an age of metal and machines, of engines and augmentation.

However, not everyone welcomes your mechanised inventiveness; great change brings great fear and, perhaps, persecution.

Steam and Steel is a source book for FateStorm™ Ascendancy–Rogue Marshal. It provides detailed information about technologies, including steam and clockwork, tools and magical machines as well as skills not covered in the core rule book, such as mechanartis, which is the merging of technology and magic.

A supplementary book for the adept vocation, Steam and Steel outlines new vocational paths for the adept to follow, new assets to covet and advanced weaves that the versatile adept can make good use of. The file is a print ready, optimised, PDF; with page previews, bookmarks, hyperlinked contents list and a glossary.

Here’s what you get.

Details of past and present technological advances
Special benefits from adept only organisations
The Technoshaman in greater detail
Five new prowess
Three new talents
New allies, possessions and personalities perfect for the old hand or newbie adept
Four new adept vocations
New equipment and weapons
Making cogmetich, biometich and asseametich machines
How to design and build cogolems and WarGears
Seven new assea weaves tailored to the versatile adept
Rules for WarGear piloting and combat
Four WarGear profiles from the Ministry of Arms ‘Ironjaws’ special forces.

141561.name: Ascendancy: Rogue Marshal - Steam and Steel Design Primer
141561.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supplement for the design of mechanartis devices and design methodology

This supplement for Steam and Steel–Rogue Marshal gives details on how to design and build your own mechanartis objects, cogolems and WarGears.

Here’s what you get.

Cogolem/WarGear record sheet
Story cast member profile, Malakai Jhona Swit, Master of the School of Applied Forces and Determined Results at the University of St Domswart
Design process and profile: Greyshield cogolem
Design process and profile: Boilersuit WarGear
Design process and profile: Bonecrusher cogmetich limb
Two bonus assea weaves to complement mechanartis design

141562.name: Roll XX: Double Damage
141562.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's the automaton's origin?
Who else seeks the treasure within this dungeon?
What was found at the base of the obelisk?
What has the disgraced priest summoned?

Roll XX: Double Damage is a book of random tables for fantasy role-playing games. Packed with adventure seeds, dungeon encounters, NPCs, magic items, treasure, and locations, Roll XX features 20 questions and 450 answers.

It also includes an ugly-as-sin monster generator in the back with over 10,000,000,000 murderous combinations.

141563.name: Vast & Starlit
rpghonor: 2013 Indie RPG Awards Most Innovative Game Runner-Up
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
141563.description:
From the publisher's website (http://www.dig1000holes.com/vast-starlit/): "A nano-game of interstellar crime & rebellion...
The core rulebook. A universe of adventure that fits in your pocket. Just under 445 words long, and jam packed with all you need to play:

• Character creation rules;
• Rules for creating your rogue vessel;
• Aggressive GM-full, drama-forward, scene now, story framing mechanics;
• Complete rules for creating alien species, cultures and environments;
• And bold diceless resolution mechanics."

141564.name: Bodies in the Dark
rpghonor: 2013 Indie Supplement of the Year Runner-Up
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
141564.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The sex and warfare supplement. Romance among the stars! Orbital bombardments of the moon! The longest book in the library, clocking in at just over 460 words long in two full-color pages, this tome includes:

• Rules for commanding troops and seducing lovers;
• Tension mechanics for turning up the heat on a firefight or romance;
• Add-ons to make sexier or more warlike alien species, cultures and environments;
• Mechanics for handling long military campaigns and drawn out love affairs;
• And forbidden taboos!"

141565.name: Stellar Atlas
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
141565.description:
From the publisher's website:

"A full-color map of the entire galaxy rendered in loving detail over a gorgeous two-page spread."

The description is a bit tongue-in-cheek, as each page of this spread is about the size of a business card.

"Also included:

• Mechanics to govern interstellar travel and pursuit;
• Add-ons to customize alien species, cultures and environments to their origin in the galaxy;
• And a complete account of the Seven Wonders of the Galaxy."

141566.name: Renegade's Technical Manual
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
141566.description:
From the publisher's website:

"This is the one for all you savvyheads out there. Gear, gear, gear. Almost 450 words of technical know-how, this full-color manual includes:

Rules for creating new and alien technology;
Calibration mechanics to make sure everyone is on the same page when it comes to the wacky, weird and powerful;
Guidelines for customizing technologies to the cultures that created them;
Customization rules for the player character’s personal gear;
And rules for building, repairing, inventing, constructing, jury rigging, and demolition on a deadline or at the sort of leisurely pace only interstellar travel can allow."

boardgamecompilation: The Lost Pueblo of Doctor Green
141567.description:
The Cheapass Games Poker Suite compiles several games designed by James Ernest (and sometimes others) for play with traditional playing cards. Some were previously published, some were not. Despite the name, few of the games bear much relation to the Poker family of games.

Each game has its own entry on BGG.
141567.name: Poker Suite

141568.name: What is a Roleplaying Game?
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
141568.description: From the publisher's website: "[A] tiny, but complete roleplaying game designed for the uninitiated. It’s a quick game meant to give people an honest taste of the hobby minus the giant, intimidating rulebooks."

141569.name: CrossWays
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Party Gamecast Reviews - CrossWays
141569.description:
In CrossWays players want to be the first to build a path of their pieces from one side of the game board to the opposite side, but to build they need to use the cards they draw and have in hand.

On a turn, a player can lay down a single card (e.g., a red 9) and place one of their pieces on this space on the game board; she can also lay down a pair of cards with the same value and place two of her pieces in a stack on any space, including the white ones that are otherwise off-limits. If a player has two pieces in a row on a stack, no one else can play on top of that stack – but by playing a suited run of cards, a player can remove pieces already on the board, putting those spaces into play once again.

141571.description: Fortune and Glory: Danger Pack 1 Supplement is a small expansion of 14 new cards for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game that is available only through the publisher, Flying Frog Productions.
141571.name: Fortune and Glory: Danger Pack 1 Supplement

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
141572.description:
You are a paperback author trying to finish novels for your editor. Complete Westerns, Science Fiction, Romance or even the rare Best-Seller. Live the dream — and maybe pay the bills.

Word-building meets deck-building in the unique game Paperback. Players start with a deck of letter cards and wild cards. Each hand they form words, and purchase more powerful letters based on how well their word scored. Most letters have abilities that activate when they are used in a word, such as drawing more cards or double letter score. Players buy wilds to gain victory points. Variant included for cooperative play.
141572.name: Paperback
boardgamepodcastepisode: #34: Double Six-Pack Review! 7 Wonders Duel & Agamemnon; 7 Wonders on Tap; iOS game reviews
BGA Ep 55 - BGA Court: Gaming vs. Cheating
BGA Ep 64 - Controversy in Tabletop Gaming
BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
Boards Alive Monster Mash-up - Episode 5
Cardboard Insanity - Episode 2
Deckbuilder Review Special
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 40 - When Colts Cry
Episode 17 - Family Affair
Episode 2 - A-B-C, 1-2-3
Episode 3 - The Baby’s Asleep…Quick, Grab a Game!
Episode 35: Word/Deck Building Episode (ft. Paperback, Dexicon, Seven7s)
Episode 50 - Interview with Rob Daviau and Matt Leacock
Episode 5: Mice & Mystics, Escape from New York, and Lords of Waterdeep
Episode 8 - Back to School
Episode 8 - The Best Decks Money Can Build
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 122
The Long View: Dice Games
The Spiel #203 - Beyond Scrabble
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 99

141573.name: Magic Carpet (TRS-80)
141573.description:
Game Manual

Suppose you were the director of a movie or the writer of a story. Maybe Luke wouldn't have lost his hand, or maybe you would make Dracula a seven year old boy. Wouldn't it be fun if you could tell the hero what to do?

The Magic Carpet is a very special kind of story called Interactive Fiction. You get to take part in the story, by deciding where the story should go next. You tell David, the boy in the story, exactly what to do.

You can read the story over and over again, each time making a different choice at different points. The story and the ending will be different each time, depending on how you chose. Some endings are happy, while other endings are tragic. You decide.

141574.name: Distant Worlds - Shadows
141574.description:
Distant Worlds: Shadows is the highly anticipated third expansion to the critically acclaimed 4X space strategy game. Distant Worlds: Shadows adds incredible new gameplay to the Distant Worlds universe and includes an earlier era in the Distant Worlds timeline, called the Age of Shadows.

Start a new empire before the discovery of hyperspace travel and try to expand into the stars, or play as one of the legendary Pirate factions of the Age of Shadows, competing with new victory conditions to establish an alternate history where the pirates triumphed over the planetary civilizations. The pirate options alone include four completely new playstyles (ranging from Raiders to Smugglers) and new smuggling and mercenary missions. Also included are ship boarding actions and ship and base capture, new Ship Captain characters and pirate raids of planets and space stations.

New gameplay also includes expanded ground combat, with a full new ground combat tech tree, a ground combat resolution screen and multiple different troop types (infantry, armor, planetary defences and special forces). Ground combat is now animated and resolved from the descent of the first assault pods from orbit to the final battles for planetary control, with new bonuses for combined arms and the effects of the different troop types as well as local space superiority all considered in the outcome.

The expanded tech tree also includes Gravitic Weapons and Tractor Beams as well as additional planetary facilities that allow you more customization on character recruitment.

Distant Worlds: Shadows also includes an updated and improved graphical engine that allows for much better performance in the epic 1,000+ star galaxies that many Distant Worlds fans enjoy. The AI is also much improved, especially in terms of the economy and a new comprehensive difficulty setting should mean that even the most experienced Distant Worlds player will find a challenge in Distant Worlds: Shadows. As usual, modding support has been kept up to date with the new improvements.

Source: The Publisher Website.

141575.name: Forge of Freedom: The American Civil War 1861-1865
141575.description:
Forge of Freedom: The American Civil War 1861-1865 combines grand strategy with battlefield tactics in one game, putting you in command at every level of the Civil War, from the mobilization of your nation’s resources to the control of individual brigades during the fury of battle. Relive the days of America’s greatest struggle: a time of blood, smoke, and glory.

Forge of Freedom is packed with historical detail. Control the careers of more than 1,000 generals – every general of the Civil War era. Equip your units with one of more than 50 types of period firearms and artillery. Field armies containing the Iron Brigade, the Orphan Brigade or 100 other legendary units. Choose your units’ standards from a collection of over 700 authentic flags. Allocate resources toward research in order to gain improved technology and logistical support in five different areas of research. Engage in diplomacy with European powers and in domestic politics with historically accurate state governors. Command your navy to hunt blockade runners, blockade ports, launch amphibious assaults, and bombard forts. Customize your brigades by adding personnel and equipment: train sharpshooters and Zouaves, equip reconnaissance balloons and horse artillery, deploy raiders and scouts, manage engineers and signal corps, and much more!

Forge of Freedom allows you to customize the game rules: play with just the amount of complexity that you enjoy. The turn-based game structure allows you to play at your own pace. Battles can be resolved quickly or fought on a detailed battle map using a comprehensive system that models fatigue, morale, supply, facing, formation, time of day, reinforcements, command-and-control, weather, and even battlefield smoke.

Source: The Publisher Website.

141576.name: Legion Arena: Cult of Mithras
141576.description:
Legion Arena: Cult of Mithras is an expansion for Legion Arena. It allows you to take your army from the Roman campaign on new adventures. In this glorious year of 27 BC, Octavian has been crowned Emperor Augustus of Rome. His enemies lie defeated, his Empire basks in victory. Yet in one corner of the Empire, Spain still resists and troops are dispatched to subdue the region once and for all. You are picked to lead the men. This is your chance to prove yourself - this is your destiny. But fate is a fickle master. On route to Spain, your men are ambushed. A tribe still loyal to Pompey's perhaps? There is no time to think, only fight! The enemy are many, you are unprepared. It is all you can do to fend them off as you yell orders to your men. A soldier is shouting at you "General! General, are you alright!" Blood stains your clothing. By the Gods, I am wounded! And then there is only darkness...

_______________________________________________________

Features

35 new battles across 7 campaigns.

7 new fantasy unit types including Fire Demons, Shadow Warriors and Ghost Legions.

Enhanced storyline, that really draws you in.

Linked battles that prevent healing up between and add a whole new layer of strategy.

New graphical effects.

New specialist equipment.

Source: The Developer Website.

141577.description:
It is a funny card party game about finding right words. Players trying to find words matching category shown by card and starting from letters shown by cards.

It is an easier and smaller version of a game SłowoStwory.
141577.name: SłowoStworki
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

141578.description:
Small family game based on a idea of tic-tac-toe. Players are placing tiles with different shapes and colours trying to make a line of three of the same shape or colour.

The game is based on a pattern building and memory element cause players need to remeber what tiles their opponents took from the supply.

It includes a fun team variant for four players.
141578.name: Kolorowy zawrót głowy
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

141579.description: Family game about colours. Players are collecting colour tiles of three basic colours: red, blue and yellow. Then trying to flip the right image which can be drawn. The images are made from basic and advanced colours. To draw an advanced colour, a player needs to have two basic ones, for example yellow and red to make orange.
141579.name: Granie w malowanie
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

141580.name: Boomtown Tycoon
141580.description:
The west is yours to take — if you’re strong enough to take it! You are a prospector from humble beginnings who has journeyed far and wide in search of your fortune. With only a few tools and basic resources, you start mining in hopes of striking it rich. In this wild west, gold-mining, city-building card game, you quickly find that you must be tenacious!

There’s only so much gold in the hills and you must compete with rival prospectors to claim it. This deckbuilding game starts out relatively simple and becomes progressively more complex. Players begin the game with identical decks of cards that consist of basic resources such as labor, brick, lumber, food, and silver. They can use silver and eventually gold to trade these resources for more advanced resources in the market such as pickaxe, guns, leather, and paper. Different combinations of these resources allow players to purchase event cards, wanted cards, and building cards. As a result, these cards give individuals easier access to gold and provide a specified number of victory points.

To outmatch your opponents, your strategy may consist of cunning intellect or brutal aggression. Be the architect of a sluice box, which reduces the amount of labor needed to mine gold, or build a gangster hideout to attack your opponents. When all of the gold is mined, the player with the most victory points wins and becomes the legendary boomtown tycoon!

141581.name: Scourge of the Demon Wolf
141581.description:
From the rear cover:

Three died. They were mauled beyond recognition. The Baron sent his huntsmen to kill the beasts and for a fortnight they tramped across the countryside. Between their whoring and drinking they killed twelve wolves, parading their skins through the village. They were hung on poles as trophies of victory. Then the huntsmen left, the beasts slain, the village saved… so we thought.

As the fields turned golden under the summer sun the killings began again. Four more died. Then the Baron's man, the bailiff, was killed on the high meadow in sight of Mitra's Temple. His screams could be heard well into the village. He was only identified after we reassembled the pieces.

With the priest's help I wrote a report to our liege, the Baron of Westtower. My report ended with,
There will be no harvest until the beast is slain and the killings stopped.

141582.name: Census
141582.description:
From the back of the box:

A hospital census is a report showing each patient’s name, diagnosis, and bed number. Managers have an endless battle on their hands moving patients from the waiting room into appropriate beds.

In Census, each player builds a unique hospital by fundraising, buying different types of beds and equipment, and hiring doctors. Each year the hospitals grow, but the number of patients coming for help grows as well.

Successful hospitals will win awards – and the ability to shut down opposing players’ beds! Poorly managed hospitals will begin to see their patients pile up in the waiting room, and stolen away by other hospitals! Do you have what it takes to keep your hospital running smoothly, outshining your competitors? Grab your Census today and find out!

141583.description:
There is an old myth saying that deep in the Caribbean Sea there is a small secluded island. It is named “Isle of the Playful Moon”. Twenty years ago, the owner of the island Mr Scotty lost its ownership on a hand of poker. The new owner an eccentric British entrepreneur decided to fulfil his dream by building a Luna Park on his new property. Sadly for him, the staff he chose to run the park were not the most suitable candidates for such endeavour...
Years of poor maintenance and negligence have brought the park in a state of desertion and total disarray. Mr Funfair was ready to give up his dream and return home when he saw a small life boat named Shinky reaching his island. The teens in that life boat are the last survivors of a shipwreck and his only hope to restore his park and keep his dream alive.

So what is Luna Park World? We could say that it is an amalgam of tantalizing strategic thought, high adrenaline and suspense! The variety of the gameplay modes as well as the different ways to move around the board, ensure that no two games will ever be the same.

Let's talk about the Gameplay Modes.

First comes the Competitive mode. In this mode each player chooses one of the teen heroes and competes against his friends in a fast paced duel of wits and will. The goal of this mode is to collect more keys and trophies as well as unlock more games and rides than the competitors. The players also have three potions in their hands, each of them granting a different boon.
The second mode is a co-operative one we call ‘Mayhem’. This is because up to 12 players can participate in this breathtaking yet unforgiving mode. The players choose among the six heroes or the six guardians (each one with his unique special ability) and participate in a chaotic race against the other team. The teens try to unlock all the games and rides of the park and the guardians to stop and arrest them!
The last mode and - needless to say - our pride is the Campaign mode. You may choose a teen hero and lead him through a series of quests and stages to obtain the title "Lord of the Keys". Unfortunately, the guardians of Luna Park World will make the journey of the hero even harder by placing traps and chasing the hero around. So buy potions, act wisely and maybe at the end of the campaign you will be the one holding the One Key.
141583.name: Luna Park World: Island

141584.description: Heart tokens that replace the cubes in the Love Letter card game.
141584.name: Love Letter: Heart Tokens

141585.description:
A strategy board game for 2-4 players.

Based on classic B-movies, Zombies, Aliens & Monsters (oh my!) simulates a city under siege from a horde of zombies, invading aliens and a rampaging monster all at the same time!

A bustling city, just another day... BOOM! A huge alien structure lands in the middle of the central business district, it dwarfs the neighbouring buildings. Lights come on inside and little green men with strange weapons begin marching out and heading towards the nearby hospital. People begin to panic and run when in the distance we see an enormous reptilian monster crushing buildings and roaring in fury as it heads closer. We turn and run the other way, and are faced with a horde of grey skinned Undead. Wailing sirens approach, gunfire can be heard and in the background the sky glows red...

Defend or conquer the city with 4 completely different factions;


Humans - defend the city from invaders utilising armed civilians, police and the army. Protect your buildings and attempt to herd panicking civilians to safety.



Zombies - start off as a small mob of hungry young zombies and grow your family to spread across the city.



Aliens - drop bases of operations from your mothership into the city, from where you can begin beaming in your highly specialised army of troops, mutants and war machines. Convert human buildings to add to your new colony!



Monster - crush all buildings, consume all the little tasty meats running about the city, set fire to everything else!


Every game is randomly set up and chance allows varying factions to have advantages over others in various situations. When all else fails - fire cleanses all evils... and brings the entire city down to rubble.

By Australian Independent board games designer Ambivalent Overlord Games. Follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/ambivalentoverlord
On Pozible: www.pozible.com/zam
141585.name: Zombies, Aliens & Monsters (oh my!)

141586.name: Dragon Templates Volume 1: A to H
141586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Templates are a handy way to give a spin on an existing creature. They tell you what has changed, what advantages they have and sometimes, a bit more.

Presented here are 20+ templates (and a few variant templates) to give your base dragons some variations.

This volume covers A through to H.

Novus Draco is not needed to use this but is highly recommended.

141587.name: Dragon Templates Volume 2: I to O
141587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Templates are a handy way to give a spin on an existing creature. They tell you what has changed, what advantages they have and sometimes, a bit more.

Presented here are 7 templates ( to give your base dragons some variations.

This volume covers I through to O.

Novus Draco is not needed to use this but is highly recommended.

141588.name: Dragon Templates Volume 3: P to Z
141588.description:
From publisher blurb:

Templates are a handy way to give a spin on an existing creature. They tell you what has changed, what advantages they have and sometimes, a bit more.

Presented here are 7 templates ( to give your base dragons some variations.

This volume covers P through to Z.

Novus Draco is not needed to use this but is highly recommended.

141589.name: Dragon Feats
141589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats are ways of giving powers and abilities to both creatures and PCs, a way to tweak them and make them unique or give them extra skills to use.

Presented here are 8 feats that dragons can use. A few are suitable for non-dragons.

This is to supplement the feats found in Novus Draco (also by Ennead games), but it is not needed to use this product.

141590.name: Body Parts & Harvesting
141590.description:
From publisher blurb:

At some point, after killing a dragon, one or more enterprising heroes are going to wonder what the corpse itself is worth, or even just a part of it.

Presented here are details about the various body parts, what they are worth, some equipment and food and drink based off these body parts, with a few plot hooks as well.

Novus Draco is not needed to use this but is highly recommended as is “Death Effects”, also by Ennead Games as it makes harvesting more risky and a race against the clock.

141591.name: Breath Weapons
141591.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not just for dragons…

Breath weapons are in impressive addition to any creatures’ arsenal. The expelling of , well, something, from its mouth can be both surprising and dangerous.

They come in many verities and forms, from the classic cone of fire used by certain dragons, to the line of pure force. Some breaths are known to even heal or move earth

The information presented here takes from, and expands on, the information found in Novus Draco, but modified for all creatures with a breath weapon.

141592.name: Glade of the Unicorn
141592.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Glade of the Unicorn adventure takes place on one of the kids' routine patrols into the Darkenwold Woods. During their patrol they rescue a unicorn a pack of marauding goblins. The unicorn has been mortally wounded in the attack, so the kids must quest deeper into the forest to find a cure.

Adventure with nine encounters and nine new maps
Includes seven monsters: Wolf, dire wolf, and a full set of goblins

141593.name: Tübinger Stocherkahnrennen
141593.description:
Tübingen is a traditional university town in central Baden-Württemberg, Germany. Once a year during the Feast of Corpus Christi there is a punt boat race (Stocherkahnrennen) in which competitors are mostly students. This is a very important local and touristic event which gathers usually about 10.000 spectators.

This boardgame tells us about this event. Each player controls 3 or 4 punt boats (depending on the number of players). On each turn a player rolls a d6. If he rolls 1-5, he moves certain number of fields forward or diagonal. If he rolls a 6, he must roll an event die (d8). If the result of the event die is 1-6, the player moves accordingly but if the result is 7-8, he looses his turn.

Punt boats can also be sunk. To sink a boat it must be surrounded by opponent's boats. Sunk boats return to the start fields or to the anchor field.

The game ends when all punt boats arrive to the finish line. Each boat recevies points adequate to its position on the finish line. 1 point for 1st place, 2 for 2nd, etc. The winner is the player with the least points.

141594.name: Fleet Admiral
141594.description:
From the back of the box.

Fleet Admiral is a card game about becoming a fleet admiral. Take your intrepid crew on missions, earn prestige, upgrade your ship. Solve a galactic crisis. And do it all faster than your opponents, because they want to be in charge too.
End of box

You are in command of a space vessel from one of the major powers of the Portable Galactic Empire (Human, Brerasan, Hragsh or Jasl-Riin). You want to become the fleet admiral.

You begin the game with a frigate from your race with a power/up grade cost of 1. One level 1 crew member (orange shirt AKA (also known as) Operations, or a green shirt AKA Marine, or a blue shirt AKA Command) think Star Trek shirts with the colors changed.

You also draw one level 1 Component card. there are four types (weapons, power, sensors and defence). Each of these card types has three specialty sub groups in their category. When you add these cards to your ship you put them under your player board (ship), similar to Glory to Rome.

Game play:
There are two decks of cards (component and crew). On your turn you go on a "mission". An 8 sided die is rolled. Four symbols on the die match the crew deck, 4 match the component deck, 1 thumbs up and 1 explosion. If you roll a symbol with one of the two deck symbols you draw one card from that deck. On the upper portion of the card there will be one or two symbols. If you don't have Crew or Components that match the symbol or symbols the mission is failed. If you can match the first card you must roll again and draw another card. Now you must be able to match up evenly with what is on the cards to what is on your ship. Lets say the first card required a missile. This is a subset of the weapon card. So if you have a weapon card on your ship it must also be specific to the missile to pass phase one of this mission. The second card drawn required an orange shirt. Lets say you only have a green shirt assigned to the security section of your ship. No worries. As captain you count as one crewman of any shirt color. You have passed the second part of the mission. You could push your luck and roll the die again for a third part of the mission, but if you fail the requirement of the third card the entire mission fails. So you stop at two. You may now attach these cards to your ship if you wish. The first card was a crewman. You assign his orange shirt self to your medical station. The second card was Defenses, sub-set shields. You put it on your ship. These cards now help you win future missions.
