Despite this, many will still choose to follow this path, in spite of the warnings and the best efforts of those who will come before. The cycle of destruction may one day well become one of rebirth, provided any of those with draconic blood can they themselves put a stop to it.

Included:


Six new dragons: Blade, Gray, Orange, Rust, Steel, and Yellow
Dragon blooded: A champion who taps into the power of draconic blood to bring foes to destruction, whether on the battlefield or off.
Six dragon blooded alternates based on new dragons.

141965.name: Racial Guide
141965.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Who are you?

Elves are graceful. Orcs are brutish. Tieflings are mischievous. These are all stereotypes that one can glean from one source or another. Ultimately, you can use the knowledge of stereotypes to make your character more interesting by utilizing or breaking a race/class stereotype. Presented in this book is all you need in order to dive into their cultural and societal background as you explore new worlds!

Included:


25 pages of New Races!
A section on how race influences class
7 New Races (Vosa, Faun, Tao Reaven, Sproutlings, Pariah, Ratels, Drakken)
1 New Racial Template (Gemini)
1 New Racial Paragon Class (Twinbound)

141966.name: Little Red Goblin Games Bestiary
141966.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Little Red Bestiary is finally here! With a number of new adversaries from myth and legend as well as some completely original concepts, the Bestiary has monsters covering a broad range of levels and types to add plenty of variety and fun to your game! Get caught up in the hunt for the Bestiary today!


10 New Monsters Ranging from CR 2 to CR 20
Monsters with Variable Abilities to add Diversity to Encounters
A Broad Range of Roles, from Deadly Adversaries such as the Helmsplitter to Tricksters like the Black Dog

141967.name: Champions of Magic
141967.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Mage Like No Other!

Not every mage wears robes, a pointy hat, and carries a staff. What a colorless world it would be if everyone’s color spray was the same rainbow!

No!

Mages are an ambitious, adventurous, imaginative, and—quite frankly—a vain lot.

It’s unsurprising then that many seek to develop their own unique styles of spellcraft.

Some study the intricacies of a single spell while others pioneer the magic’s of space & time. Still others attempt to subjugate fell powers beyond mortal reckoning.

Presented within the pages of this tome are various champions of magic who have carved for themselves a unique place in the history of the arcane arts.

Included:


17 pages of Mage-Themed Goodness!
The hex-casting, weapon morphing, Wytchblade!
Pick a few spells and become a GOD with them with the Maven prestige class!
Control time & space with the Time Traveler prestige class! (Even roll back time!)

141968.name: Fury of the Elements
141968.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Command the Elements!

The awesome powers of the elements are at your fingertips with the new elementalist class from Little Red Goblin Games! Using miniature portals called meridians, the elementalist makes the battlefield her own, flinging blasts of flame and lightning, bringing forth walls of earth to hinder foes only to have the wall explode in a hail of acid just as they clear it. With 40 new elemental spells usable by a variety of classes, the fury is barely contained within this tome. Will you be the one to let it loose?

Included:


24 pages of elemental-themed Goodness!
The elementalist base class
40 new spells

141969.name: King of the Ring
141969.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can you smell what Little Red is cook'en?

"Jigsaw McGraw stood, entire body tense, as the dragon landed before them. The half-orc licked his non-broken tusk as his friends tried to calm the wyrm from his chosen course of action. Something about burning down an entire village for not giving it a whole flock of sheep. That didn’t matter to Jigsaw, he was more interested in this new challenge. The defiant roar of the dragon made him smile, as he knew it would soon be his time to shine. Their wizard loosed bolts of arcane power, their fighter launched a volley of arrows, their cleric prepared people for battle. Jigsaw ran, full tilt at the dragon. He brought his hands up briefly to cover his eyes, as he ran through the cone of flame the dragon spat forth from it’s gaping maw. He reached his arms out tightening across the front muscles of the great beast, his body’s internal energy seeping into his skin and hardening it against the onslaught that would be awaiting him at the dragon’s scything claws. His friends continued to batter the beast as it tore into him with tooth and nail. Jigsaw strained every muscle in his body as he lifted and lifted and lifted. He held the dragon over his head and brought him down hard behind him, laying it down on top of its own wings. He had done it, he had suplexed the dragon."

Included:


Hitting the mat with 17 pages of drop-kicking, bone crunching wrestling centric materail!
And introducing.... theeeeeee wreeeestler base class!
And the superheavy weight, weighing in at 2 times the normal weight of a monk, the imovable rock, the beast from east, theeee rikishi (AKA the sumo wrestler)!
And what's that?! Oh! Can it be! We've got 6 magic luchador masks!
Rounding out the evening are a whole slew of new feats and the ring... of the ring

141970.name: Primal Host
141970.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Symbiotes and parasites and hosts- oh my!

The idea of a human as a "host" has become a often explored trope in this day and age. Some common examples are: the Goa'uld, the Yeerks, Venom of spider-man fame, Starro's minions, the Bugs from Starship Trooper, Trill (to a degree), and many more. We've developed the book of Symbiosis to reflect this new trope.

Included:

The "Primal Host" base class. They utalized powerful symbiotes to devistate their foes. However... there is a price. You must allow your symboiote to "indulge" and use a fun new relationship mechanic to gain the maximum potential from your body's guest!
Extra feats
Symbiotic Item: New living wondrous items that bond themselves to you (I say "wondrous" but they are actually non-magical) Included are ways to design these items, a dozen new items, and some very creepy cloaks!

141971.name: Substitution Classes
141971.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Saints, and Liches, and Vampires OH MY!

“Krel?” Tala gasped as the robed figure stepped through the nimbus of holy light and rested a hand on her shoulder.
She felt her wounds closing, dirt and irritants working their way free of her body as the gashes sealed up. “We thought you died holding back the goblins.”

“I did,” the cleric replied as he helped her to her feet, “but I have work to do yet.” More divine light surged from the resurrected cleric’s glowing form, bathing the broken bodies of his friends in healing luminescence. Bones fused together, and bruises faded away instantly. The creatures surrounding the party they had thought defeated took a few nervous steps back from the light. Krel’s smile widened as Elshrin and Mierlek readied their weapons with renewed vigor. It was good to be back.

A New Kind of Class

A substitution class is a class that in some way replaces existing class levels. Presented in this supplement are three such classes, the saint, the lich, and the vampie. The saint is a good aligned character who was brought back to life by a deityafter committing a great deed. They lose all their class levels and gain an equal number of levels of saint. The lich is a powerful spellcaster who was granted perpetual life by a powerful ritual. A lich can take as many levels of the lich substitution class as class levels they sacrifice at the time of the ritual. This gives them more undead powers at the cost of their existing abilities. Vampires sacrifice as many levels as they can (to a maximum of 10) in exchange for an equal number of vampire levels. Regardless of what level a character is when they enter a substitution class, they may continue to gain levels in a substitution class when they level up as normal. For instance, a character who traded 5 levels of cleric for 5 levels of saint could continue to level up as a saint.

This Book Includes:


New "Substitution Class" Rules
The Saint Substitution Class
The Lich Substituion Class
The Vampie Substituion Class

141972.name: Tome of Bizarre
141972.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Step right up to see our latest attraction!
We've had our goblins scouring the realms for some of the strangest and most interesting classes and prestige classes they could find. We're proud to say that those not devoured by horrible monstrosities or gluttonous mages have done us proud.

This Cornucopia of the Strange Includes:


New Prestige Classes


The cultist: a summoner of eldritch abominations
The gastromancer: a gluttonous mage who sees food and magic as one in the same
The sword dancer: a graceful melee combatant with special abilities based on how the character moves

The Psychic




A new, spell casting base class whose own mental powers might well overwhelm him

3 More new Prestige Classes Specifically Made for the Psychic!
The Food Mystery for the Oracle
New Feats to Tie it all Together!

141973.name: Tome of Spell and Sword
141973.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sword and Sorcery... Really

Fantasy is oft known as sword and sorcery, and this book epitomizes this title. In its pages you will discover a method of attack that uses both martial skill, and magical prowess. Will you begin to think spatially with the dimensional knight, a caster who uses his power over the arcane to create portals between two points in space? Will you call down the lightning with the thunder chief, a martial attacker with the power of the storm itself and some spell casting that reflects this? Also as a bonus included is the spellslinger, a pistolero mage who uses both spell and grit to condense spells into bullets and fire arcane power from their pistols, and plenty of new feats, magic items and enchantment abilities, and some new spells for your amazement. Open the pages of this grimoire and explore the boundaries of both spell and steel.

The Breakdown


9 New Spells: Including spells like "lower gravity" and "Backdraft", these spells will augment your steel as much as your spells!
10 New Magic Items: Add them all to your GISH's arsenal! Including the "spell charged" weapon & armor property!
Dimensional Knight (Base Class): Now you’re thinking with extra-dimensional space! This 6 level caster uses space/time magic to open portals to other places as well as distort gravity!
Thunder Chief (Base Class): Suffer the wrath of the storm! Champions of nature's fury, thunder chiefs wield elemental blades to punish those who would disrupt the harmony of nature's peace...
Spellslinger (Prestige Class): Part gunslinger and part mage but ALL grit based caster! Load your guns with rays and spells and blast your opponents to they are nothing but smoking craters.
25 New Feats: Augmenting the new classes and giving a sharper set of teeth to blended melee/magic characters like the Magus! Some spells augment your next attack after casting a spell of a specific school while others enhance your elemental damage!

141974.name: War Journal
141974.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Included:


Party Tactical Archetypes: Does your party lack cohesion? Ever wanted mechanics to reflect a UNIT rather then a few guys you picked up at a pub who happened to be the next saviors of the planet? We've got it!
Heraldry & Battle Standards: Tired of having your wizard uselessly hold that dagger? Want your bard to have a support weapon? Well we invented a system for using the great flags of war to boost morale and increase damage! (Included: The Standard Bearer Base Class)
The Veteran Adventurer: A jack-of-all-trades, master of them all! This prestige class is intended for characters who have multi-classed into too many classes and want something to reflect their varied nature. Gain limited uses of other classes class features!
Mundane Crafting Rules: Why should the mages have all the fun?! Learn to craft unique custom weapon with this new sub-system! This allows a character to make an original weapon for their own personal use! Want to add parrying flukes to your great sword? Sounds good! How about an Italian grip on that rapier? We can do that! How about a thick tip-heavy retractable extra-long spear with a spiked butt cap? We got ya' covered!

141975.name: Gargoyle Medieval Pack
141975.description:
User Summary

The Gargoyle Medieval Pack follows a conflict between elves and gargoyles. Each game is a progression in the story, beginning with an invasion of the elven castle by the beasts and ending with an all-out war of thrown rocks and loosed arrows.

The Medieval Pack contains all three Gargoyle games.

141976.name: Walk the Plank! Ghost Meeple Mini-Expansion
141976.description:
By very popular demand Mayday is making this really silly and totally unauthorized (by the designer) expansion available. The ghost meeple will be awarded to the first pirate who is fully eliminated from the game. (All 3 pirates are out.)

This player will continue to push/shove and generally cause mayhem with his ghost pirate, haunting the rest of the crew. He can't do physical things like cut or extend the plank, but can push and shove, but can't be pushed or shoved himself.

141977.description:
From Walk the Plank! Kickstarter page:

A play mat designed for play with either Get Bit or Walk the Plank!. It is 70x70cm in size and will feature UV printing. It is printed on Extreme Classic PVC 500 gsm material. This will be durable and not scratch off the top paint layer easily as it is for people to play a game on. For the packing, each piece pack with bubble bag then individually rolled in the cardboard mailers.
141977.name: Get Bit / Walk the Plank: Dual Purpose Playmat

141978.name: Princess Pony Trek
141978.description:
A pre-teens game for girls, published in an annual for Princess Comic fans. A Goose-type game, spin and move, obeying any instructions on the squares you land on. First to 60, wins.

The rules:
First you will need a top with numbers on it which you can make yourself out of a piece of plain postcard and a matchstick (see the picture above), or a dice.
Two or three of you can play this game and you will need a small coloured counter each (or a coloured bead) to represent you on your pony as you trek along. Each of you must throw the dice or spin the top in turn, and go forward the number of squares shown by the top of the dice, or the side of the top that comes to rest on the table.
But when you have reached the proper square you must follow any instructions that are lettered beside it. The winner is the one who gets back home first.

141979.name: Haunted Castle
141979.description: A game for pre-teen girls (although there is no reason why boys can't play). Published in an annual for Princess Comic readers. A simple Goose-type game. Roll and move but remember to obey any special square instructions. The first to get to Square 86 and roll a 6, wins.

141980.name: Alarm!
141980.description:
In the card game Alarm!, you play a burglar who's "hard at work" during his "nightshift". On your turn, you deal a card to each of the players that can increase or decrease that chances of that player being caught by the police – and this is a Bad Thing, of course, since the presence of the police is antithetical to you doing a good job at your work.

In the end, the player who doesn't get caught by the police wins!

141981.name: Tavern Dice
141981.description:
Tavern Dice is a push your luck dice game!

A party of heroes heads to the tavern, to drink and play before heading to a quest.

Press your luck rolling those dice, try to score points for each wizard, Rogue, Knight, Archer or Barbarian...Don´t roll the skeleton or you will lose a die.

The more of the same hero you roll on consecutive rolls the more point it will score... if you don´t roll the one you need you will lose all your acumulated points.

No more dice? You are kicked out of the tavern, into the nice mud puddle!

141982.name: Flipping Fishes
141982.description:
Flipping Fishes is a fun dexterity race game for up to 4 players or teams. Participants have cardboard "frying pans" which they use to fan or "swish" paper fish across the raceway (floor) and onto the same color plate at the finishing line.

From the box top "A fantastic fun family race game - flip your fish along the race alne and onto the dinner plate using only the frying pan! No Touching with your hands!"

141983.name: The Seal Beach Trivia Game
141983.description:
Trivial-Pursuit-like game that has players moving tokens around the game-board to answer questions in various topic categories.

Object Of the Game

The object of the game is to be the first player to work your token up to the center of the board and answer a question correctly at LEVEL 5.

141984.name: Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale
141984.description:
"Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale (怪獣が出る金曜日 Kaijū ga Deru Kinyōbi, lit. Monster Come Out on Fridays) is a life simulation game designed by Kaz Ayabe. The game follows a boy named Sohta who lives in a town where monsters and superheroes from 70s tokusatsu shows appear every Friday."

Source: Wikipedia, "Guild (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141985.name: Bugs vs. Tanks
141985.description:
"Bugs vs. Tanks (虫けら戦車 Mushikera Sensha) is a tank action game designed by Keiji Inafune. The game sees players take the role of various tanks that have been shrunk down to miniature size in order to fight against various bugs and insects."

Source: Wikipedia, "Guild (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141986.name: The Starship Damrey
141986.description:
"Starship Damrey (宇宙船ダムレイ号 Uchūsen Damurei-gō) is a survival horror game designed by Kazuya Asano and Takemaru Abiko. The game throws players into a suspenseful environment with no tutorials or hints to guide them."

Source: Wikipedia, "Guild (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141987.name: F-117A Stealth Fighter
141987.description:
From the back of the box to the North American NES edition

"The Real Stealth Fighter Experience

Strap yourself into the cockpit of the world's most elite fighting weapon! It's the F-117A Stealth Fighter. And once you fly it, you'll see why no other flight simulator compares!

Incredible 3-D graphics will keep you glued to your screen as you experience the same intense pressures that gripped America's Gulf War pilots!

Penetrate enemy airspace without being seen! Tangle with the enemy in treacherous dog-fights! Launch awesome firepower against fierce opponents!

Your wait is over. The ultimate weapon has arrived. Now it's your turn to pilot the real Stealth Fighter!


Realistic flight simulation provides unparalleled Stealth Fighter action!
One and two-player modes for team or competitive play!
Multiple skill levels for extra thrills!
Use the 'Stealthometer' to plan your flight strategy!"

boardgamecompilation: Town Center: Lower Manhattan / Paris La Cité – St. Louis
141989.description:
Town Center: Expansion n°1 consists of four additional player boards for Town Center and nine wooden cubes in an eighth color.

This player board simulates the construction of Paris – bridges, the Seine, and two small islands – and will add quite a bit of variety to the gameplay.

You can use the nine brown cubes to create a three-dimensional player board during set-up, with the cubes representing hills and mountains. Two scenarios (San Francisco and Rome) are provided in the rules, but you can also try to map the topology of your hometown or do a completely random set-up. If you crave variety, you can customize the game every time you play!
141989.name: Town Center: Expansion n°1

boardgamecompilation: Town Center: Lower Manhattan / Paris La Cité – St. Louis
141990.description:
Town Center: Expansion n°2 consists of four additional player boards for Town Center and twelve wooden cubes in a seventh color, with two different starting configurations.

This player board simulates the construction of New York City as a city with such an incredibly high density has to have its own version of Town Center. The board is topologically completely different from the original, which should alter the deepest-rooted habits of even the most experienced players. The twelve new dark green cubes represent the citizens of the city, adding new situations and new opportunities for construction to the basic game. After all, it would be a shame to build The Big Apple as a ghost town!
141990.name: Town Center: Expansion n°2

141991.name: Ёрш
141991.description:
Yorsh is a liquor game helping to have a great time in a group. Inside the box there are task and bonus cards. The main principle is as follows: you either complete the task or you drink. Bonuses are for making tasks harder or easier. During the set you will have to propose toastes with difficult words, remember car brands, football players and countiers, give a massage and swap clothes, text “I'm pregnant. What now?” to a random number, drink two glasses simultaneously, drink while jumping, drink upside down etc. All in all, you are going to have a great party.

Points for tasks written in the corner of the cards. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

141995.name: Andy Pandy and Teddy are Fast Asleep
141995.description:
Game published in the Andy Pandy's Annual, aimed at pre-school children. One player is red and the other player is blue. The red player travels along the red line and the blue travels along the blue line. Both lines are equidistant from the winning space in the middle of the board.

Moves are determined by the throw of a die. When the blue player lands on a yellow square, he goes forward two spaces. When the red player lands on a green square, he goes forward two spaces. If either player lands on a grey square, that player has to go back three spaces.

The first player to reach the centre illustration of Andy Pandy and Teddy having a sleep on a garden bench, wins.

Andy Pandy was created for the BBC television slot that later became Watch With Mother. In 1952, 13 episodes were recorded and these thirteen shows continued to be broadcast for 18 years! In 1970, the BBC made another 13 shows, this time in colour.

141997.description:
In the real-time game Chronos Conquest, an expanded version of Witty Chronos that shares the same core game mechanism, the Gods of Mount Olympus do battle with sand timers!

Each player has two or three sand timers and (at any time) may flip them onto cards from the board. A flowing sand timer may never be moved. When a player moves an empty sand timer from a card, he gains that card – provided that no other sand timer is on that card! When two players both have a sand timer on a card, the player ready to wait longest will gain it. Bargaining is allowed, though, so if you're not content to wait, try to strike a bargain.

Each card shows points (with one of the winning conditions being to reach 200 points), monsters, winds (which is another path to victory), or plagues (allowing you to, for example, place opposing sand timers in Hell).

The Greek Gods get into the game as well, with six of the thirty God cards in play each game; each God card has a special power that a player can activate by offering some of the cards he's acquired. In addition, two of nine City cards are in play each game, each with a special power that a player can activate with a sand timer.
141997.name: Chronos Conquest

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Game Accessory Nominee
141998.description:
This is the first expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four new figures (Drop Knight, Maskun John, Jems Blond, Flame Knight)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets
141998.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #1 – Fire and Ice

141999.name: Tipp-Kick Championchip
141999.description:
User Summary

The digital version of the classic tabletop soccer game Tipp-Kick.

142000.name: Striker Soccer London
142000.description:
User Summary

A classic arcade soccer game that simulates the soccer tournement of the Olympic Games 2012.
